package.name: GConf
package.summary: The GNOME configuration database system.
package.description: GConf is a configuration database for GNOME.

package.name: Guppi
package.summary: Plotting tool for GNOME
package.description: Guppi is a tool that allows you to make interactive plots of data in various ways. It is integrated with GNOME.

package.name: ORBit
package.summary: A high-performance CORBA Object Request Broker
package.description:
ORBit is a high-performance CORBA (Common Object Request Broker Architecture) ORB (object request broker). It allows programs to send requests and receive replies from other programs, regardless of the locations of the two programs. CORBA is an architecture that enables communication between program objects, regardless of the programming language they're written in or the operating system they run on.
You will need to install this package and ORBIT-devel if you want to write programs that use CORBA technology.

package.name: ORBit-devel
package.summary: A high-performance CORBA Object Request Broker.
package.description: This package contains the header files, libraries and utilities necessary to write programs that use CORBA technology. If you want to write such programs, you'll also need to install the ORBIT package.

package.name: abiword
package.summary: WYSIWYG word processor based on GTK.
package.description: AbiWord is the first of a complete, open source office suite. AbiWord is based on GTK and the original source includes crossplatform support for win32 and BeOS. AbiWord is still being developed. It's quite usable but not yet full- featured or polished. For many applications, however, it should prove effective and efficient.

package.name: audiofile
package.summary: Library to handle various audio file formats
package.description: Library to handle various audio file formats. Used by the esound daemon.

package.name: battstat_applet
package.summary: Battery status utility
package.description: A laptop battery status monitor applet for GNOME.

package.name: bonobo
package.summary: The Bonobo component system for GNOME
package.description: Bonobo is a library that provides the necessary framework for GNOME applications to deal with compound documents, i.e. those with a spreadsheet and graphic embedded in a word-processing document.

package.name: bonobo-conf
package.summary: Bonobo Configuration library
package.description: Bonobo-conf is for configuring things through bonobo.

package.name: bug-buddy
package.summary: A graphical bug reporting tool for GNOME
package.description: The goal of bug-buddy is to make reporting bugs very simple and easy for the user, while making the reports themselves more useful and informative for the developer.

package.name: control-center
package.summary: The GNOME Control Center
package.description: This package contains utilities to configure the GNOME desktop. The GNOME Control Center allows you to alter the appearance, focus behavior, screen saver, keyboard and mouse properties, and more. It's part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: control-center-devel
package.summary: The GNOME Control Center development environment
package.description:
The control-center-devel package contains the development environment needed for creating the `capplets' used in the GNOME Control Center.
If you're interested in developing capplets for the GNOME control center, you'll want to install this package.

package.name: dia
package.summary: A GTK+ based diagram editor andcharting tool
package.description: Dia is used to draw diagrams, graphs, charts, and so forth. This is an early version, but the program is fully usable. In this version there is support for UML static structure diagrams (class diagrams), Entity-Relationship diagrams and Network diagrams. Diagrams can be exported to postscript.

package.name: dia
package.summary: A GTK+ based diagram editor andcharting tool
package.description: Dia is used to draw diagrams, graphs, charts, and so forth. This is an early version, but the program is fully usable. In this version there is support for UML static structure diagrams (class diagrams), Entity-Relationship diagrams and Network diagrams. Diagrams can be exported to postscript.

package.name: eel
package.summary: Eazel Extensions Library
package.description: The eel library contains a number of generally useful classes and functions. Many of them are extensions to things in glib, gtk, gnome-libs, and other widely-used GNOME platform libraries.

package.name: eel
package.summary: Eazel Extensions Library
package.description: The eel library contains a number of generally useful classes and functions. Many of them are extensions to things in glib, gtk, gnome-libs, and other widely-used GNOME platform libraries.

package.name: eog
package.summary: The Eye of GNOME image viewer
package.description: eog, the Eye of Gnome, is a graphics viewer for GNOME which uses the gdk-pixbuf library. It can deal with large images, and zoom and scroll with constant memory usage. The goal is a standard graphics viewer for future releases of Gnome.

package.name: esound
package.summary: The Enlightened Sound Daemon
package.description: EsounD, the Enlightened Sound Daemon, is a server process that mixes several audio streams for playback by a single audio device. For example, if you're listening to music on a CD and you receive a sound-related event from ICQ, the two applications won't have to jockey for the use of your sound card. Install esound if you'd like to let sound applications share your audio device.

package.name: evo-db3
package.summary: DB3 for Evolution
package.description: This package contains an installation of the db3 library for use in compiling evolution. You shouldn't need this package unless you are compiling evolution from Ximian's SRPMS.

package.name: evo-openldap
package.summary: OpenLDAP package for use by evolution.
package.description: Contains the static libraries used to build the evolution packages.

package.name: evolution
package.summary: GNOME's next-generation groupware suite
package.description: Evolution is the GNOME mailer, calendar, contact manager and communications tool. The tools which make up Evolution will be tightly integrated with one another and act as a seamless personal information-management tool.

package.name: evolution-devel
package.summary: Libraries and include files for developing Evolution components
package.description: Evolution is the GNOME mailer, calendar, contact manager and communications tool. The tools which make up Evolution will be tightly integrated with one another and act as a seamless personal information-management tool. This package contains the files necessary to develop applications using Evolution's libraries.

package.name: evolution-pilot
package.summary: Evolution conduits for gnome-pilot
package.description: Evolution is the GNOME mailer, calendar, contact manager and communications tool. The tools which make up Evolution will be tightly integrated with one another and act as a seamless personal information-management tool. This package contains conduits needed by gnome-pilot to synchronize your Palm with Evolution

package.name: g-wrap
package.summary: Tool for simplifying mixing C and scheme
package.description: G-Wrap -- A tool for exporting C libraries into Scheme interpreters. This is a tool for specifying types, functions, and constants to import into asdf a Scheme interpreter, and for generating code (in C) to interface these to the Guile and RScheme interpreters in particular.

package.name: g-wrap-devel
package.summary: static library and header files for g-wrap
package.description: Header files and static libraries for g-wrap, a tool that simplifies mixing C and Scheme. If you need this, you almost certainly need g-wrap.

package.name: gaim
package.summary: A client for AOL's 'Instant Messenger' service
package.description: Gaim allows you to talk to anyone using AOL's Instant Messenger service (you can sign up at http://www.aim.aol.com). It uses the TOC version of the AOL protocol, so your buddy list is stored on AOL's servers and can be retrieved from anywhere. It contains many of the same features as AOL's IM client while at the same time incorporating many new features.

package.name: gal
package.summary: Gnome Application Libraries
package.description: Extra documentation and i18n files for gal.

package.name: galeon
package.summary: Mozilla-based web browser with the GNOME look and feel
package.description: Galeon is a lightweight web browser which employs the GNOME infrastructure to create a minimal, but intuitive, GUI. Galeon's use of Mozilla's Gecko rendering engine makes it more feature complete and standards complient than other lightweight browsers.

update.description: Bug Fixes, Dependency Fixes, New Upstream Version

package.name: gdk-pixbuf
package.summary: Image loading library used with GNOME
package.description: The GdkPixBuf library provides a number of features: - Image loading facilities. - Rendering of a GdkPixBuf into various formats: drawables (windows, pixmaps), GdkRGB buffers. - A cache interface

package.name: gdk-pixbuf-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for application development with gdk-pixbuf
package.description: Libraries, include files, etc you can use to develop gdk-pixbuf applications.

package.name: gdk-pixbuf-gnomecanvas
package.summary: An image loading and rendering library for Gdk.
package.description: The GdkPixBuf library provides a number of features: - Image loading facilities. - Rendering of a GdkPixBuf into various formats: drawables (windows, pixmaps), GdkRGB buffers. This package provides the GnomeCanvas version of gdk-pixbuf.

package.name: gdk-pixbuf-loaders
package.summary: The image loading libraries for gdk-pixbuf
package.description: The GdkPixBuf library provides a number of features: - Image loading facilities. - Rendering of a GdkPixBuf into various formats: drawables (windows, pixmaps), GdkRGB buffers. This package provides loaders used by all versions of gdk-pixbuf.

package.name: gdk-pixbuf-xlib
package.summary: An image loading and rendering library for Gdk.
package.description: The GdkPixBuf library provides a number of features: - Image loading facilities. - Rendering of a GdkPixBuf into various formats: drawables (windows, pixmaps), GdkRGB buffers. This package provides the Xlib version of gdk-pixbuf.

package.name: gdm
package.summary: The GNOME Display Manager, a login manager
package.description: Gdm provides the equivalent of a "login:" prompt for X displays- it pops up a login window and starts an X session. It provides all the functionality of xdm, including XDMCP support for managing remote displays. The greeting window is written using the GNOME libraries and hence looks like a GNOME application- even to the extent of supporting themes! By default, the greeter is run as an unprivileged user for security.

package.name: gedit
package.summary: A small but powerful text editor for GNOME.
package.description: gEdit is a small but powerful text editor designed expressly for GNOME. It includes such features as split-screen mode, a plugin API, which allows gEdit to be extended to support many features while remaining small at its core, multiple document editing through the use of a 'tabbed' notebook and many more functions.

package.name: gedit-devel
package.summary: Libraries needed to develop plugins for gedit
package.description: Libraries needed to develop plugins for gedit

package.name: gftp
package.summary: X/GTK+ FTP client
package.description: gFTP is a multithreaded FTP client for X written using GLib/GTK+. It features: * simultaneous downloads, * resuming of interrupted file transfers, * file transfer queues, * downloading of entire directories, * FTP and HTTP proxy support, * remote directory caching, * passive and non-passive file transfers, * drag-n-drop support, * bookmarks menu, * stop button, and many more features.

update.description: New Upstream release with some minor bug fixes

package.name: gimp
package.summary: The GNU Image Manipulation Program
package.description: The GIMP is an image manipulation program suitable for photo retouching, image composition and image authoring. Many people find it extremely useful in creating logos and other graphics for web pages. The GIMP has many of the tools and filters you would expect to find in similar commercial offerings, and some interesting extras as well. The GIMP provides a large image manipulation toolbox, including channel operations and layers, effects, sub-pixel imaging and anti-aliasing, and conversions, all with multi-level undo. This version of The GIMP includes a scripting facility, but many of the included scripts rely on fonts that we cannot distribute. The GIMP ftp site has a package of fonts that you can install by yourself, which includes all the fonts needed to run the included scripts. Some of the fonts have unusual licensing requirements; all the licenses are documented in the package. Get ftp://ftp.gimp.org/pub/gimp/fonts/freefonts-0.10.tar.gz and ftp://ftp.gimp.org/pub/gimp/fonts/sharefonts-0.10.tar.gz if you are so inclined. Alternatively, choose fonts which exist on your system before running the scripts.

package.name: gimp-perl
package.summary: GIMP perl extensions and plugins
package.description: This is a collection of plugins for the gimp written in perl, and the perl modules needed to use them.

package.name: glade
package.summary: Tools for building GTK+ graphical interfaces
package.description:
GLADE is a free user interface builder for GTK+ and GNOME. GLADE can produce C source code; C++, Ada95, Python and Perl support is also available, via external tools which process the XML interface description files output by GLADE. GLADE supports most GTK+ 1.2 widgets. Support for styles, however, is not complete.
Install glade if you need an interface builder for GTK+ and GNOME.

package.name: gmc
package.summary: The GNOME version of the Midnight Commander file manager.
package.description:
GMC (GNU Midnight Commander) is a file manager based on the terminal version of Midnight Commander, with the addition of a GNOME GUI desktop front-end. GMC can FTP, view TAR and compressed files and look into RPMs for specific files.
Install gmc if you're installing GNOME and you'd like to use the Midnight Commander file manager with it.

package.name: gnome-applets
package.summary: Applets for the GNOME Panel
package.description: A collection of GNOME Panel applets. These small programs run inside your GNOME Panel.

package.name: gnome-audio
package.summary: GNOME audio files
package.description: Sound files for the GNOME desktop environment

package.name: gnome-core
package.summary: The core programs for the GNOME GUI desktop environment.
package.description: The gnome-core package includes the basic programs and libraries that are needed to install GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software. You should install the gnome-core package if you would like to use the GNOME desktop environment. You'll also need to install the gnome-libs package. If you would like to develop GNOME applications, you'll also need to install gnome-libs-devel.

update.description: New upstream release with many bug fixes and feature enhancements

package.name: gnome-core-devel
package.summary: Panel libraries and header files for creating GNOME panels.
package.description: The gnome-core package includes the basic programs and libraries that are needed to install GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software. You should install the gnome-core package if you would like to use the GNOME desktop environment. You'll also need to install the gnome-libs package. If you would like to develop GNOME applications, you'll also need to install gnome-libs-devel.

update.description: New upstream release with many bug fixes and feature enhancements

package.name: gnome-games
package.summary: A collection of games for GNOME
package.description: The gnome-games package includes games for the GNOME GUI desktop environment, including gtali, freecell, gnibbles, gnobots, gnobots2, gnome-stones, gnomine, gnotravex, gtali, iagno, mahjongg, same-gnome, and sol. Install gnome-games if you want games to play within GNOME.

package.name: gnome-games-devel
package.summary: GNOME games development libraries.
package.description: The gnome-games-devel package installs the libraries and files needed to develop games for the GNOME GUI desktop environment. Install gnome-games-devel if you're developing games for GNOME.

package.name: gnome-guile
package.summary: Guile language bindings for the GNOME libraries
package.description: A set of bindings to the Guile language for the GNOME libraries.

package.name: gnome-guile-devel
package.summary: Development files for use with GNOME Guile bindings.
package.description: Files for use in the development of Guile-based GNOME applications

package.name: gnome-libs
package.summary: Main GNOME libraries
package.description: GNOME (GNU Network Object Model Environment) is a user-friendly set of GUI applications and desktop tools to be used in conjunction with a window manager for the X Window System. The gnome-libs-devel package includes the libraries and include files that you will need to develop GNOME applications.

update.description: Support for parallel installs with the GNOME 2.0 platform

package.name: gnome-libs-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for GNOME application
package.description: GNOME (GNU Network Object Model Environment) is a user-friendly set of GUI applications and desktop tools to be used in conjunction with a window manager for the X Window System. The gnome-libs-devel package includes the libraries and include files that you will need to develop GNOME applications. You should install the gnome-libs-devel package if you would like to develop GNOME applications. You don't need to install gnome-libs-devel if you just want to use the GNOME desktop environment.

update.description: Support for parallel installs with the GNOME 2.0 platform

package.name: gnome-media
package.summary: A set of multimedia utilities for GNOME
package.description: This package contains gmix, a mixer; gtcd, a CD player; and vumeter, a sound output monitor. The GNOME media utilities are part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-pilot
package.summary: PalmOS link utilities
package.description: GNOME Pilot is a collection of programs and daemons for using Palm OS-based systems with GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-pilot-devel
package.summary: Pilot development header files.
package.description: GNOME Pilot is a collection of programs and daemons for using Palm OS-based systems with GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-print
package.summary: Printing libraries for GNOME
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-print
package.summary: Printing libraries for GNOME
package.description: This package contains the printing apparatus for GNOME, the complete graphical desktop environment based entirely on free software.

update.description: New Upstream Release with Bug Fixes

package.name: gnome-user-docs
package.summary: GNOME user-level documentation
package.description: GNOME user-level documentation of "general" nature, i.e. covering GNOME as a whole rather than specific applications. Examples of such documentation include users guide, introduction to GNOME, glossary, etc.

package.name: gnome-utils
package.summary: Gnome Utilities (gtt, gcalc, and more)
package.description: This package contains: gcalc - a simple calculator gcolorsel - a color selector gdialog - a Gtk version of the 'dialog' program gfontsel - a font selector gless - a Gtk version of the 'less' pager gnome-run - a graphical utility to execute a user entered command gpenguin - a penguin that follows the mouse grun - a minimal graphical utility to execute a user entered command gsearchtool - a tool for finding and grepping through files gshutdown - reboot or shutdown your machine gstripchart - plot system measurements gtt - a task timer/tracker guname - display 'uname' information about your system gw - display users on the system, like 'w' idetool - an IDE disk viewing tool splash/splac - splash screen renderer All these utilities are part of GNOME, the complete desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnome-vfs
package.summary: GNOME virtual file system library
package.description: The GNOME Virtual File System provides an abstraction to common file system operations like reading, writing and copying files, listing directories and so on. It is similar in spirit to the Midnight Commander's VFS (as it uses a similar URI scheme) but it is designed from the ground up to be extensible and to be usable from any application.

package.name: gnomeicu
package.summary: GnomeICU is an ICQ-enabled instant messenger for GNOME
package.description: With GnomeICU you can send messages to other people in the ICQ network.

package.name: gnucash
package.summary: GnuCash is an application to keep track of your finances.
package.description: GnuCash is a personal finance manager. A check-book like register GUI allows you to enter and track bank accounts, stocks, income and even currency trades. The interface is designed to be simple and easy to use, but is backed with double-entry accounting principles to ensure balanced books.

package.name: gnucash-devel
package.summary: Libraries needed to develop for gnucash
package.description: Libraries needed to develop for gnucash

package.name: gnumeric
package.summary: A spreadsheet for GNOME
package.description: Importing XLS files from Excel is only the beginning: This full-featured spreadsheet is remarkably powerful and easy to use. If you are familiar with Excel, you're ready to get to work with Gnumeric. More functionality is available through plugins such as guppi. Gnumeric is part of GNOME, the complete user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software.

package.name: gnumeric-devel
package.summary: Files necessary to develop gnumeric-based applications.
package.description: The gnumeric-devel package includes files necessary to develop gnumeric-based applications. Install gnumeric-devel if you want to develop programs which will use gnumeric.

package.name: gob
package.summary: GTK+ Object Builder
package.description: GOB is a preprocesor which simplifies the writing of GTK+ objects in C. The syntax is somewhat similar to that for Java, yacc and lex.

package.name: gphoto
package.summary: Universal application for digital cameras
package.description: Gphoto will allow downloading, saving and manipulation of images from several different camera models, or from the hardrive. It also comes with a HTML engine, to publish photos on the web, and a command line interface to use it from a script

package.name: gqview
package.summary: A simple image viewer using GTK+
package.description: Simple image browser with thumbnail capability. Uses GTK+ and Imlib.

package.name: grdb
package.summary: Set X resousrces of legacy apps based on your GTK+ theme
package.description: Grdb provides a simple way to set the X resources of legacy applications consistently with your chosen gtk theme. You must run grdb each time you change themes or add new app-defaults config files.

package.name: gtk-engines
package.summary: Assorted GTK+ theme engines
package.description: A collection of assorted GTK+ theme engines

package.name: gtk-engines-thinice
package.summary: ThinIce theme for GTK+ 1.2
package.description: This package contains a thinice 'theme' that allows you to configure the look of GTK+ 1.2-using programs. The programs need no modifications to use themes; the support is built in to GTK+ 1.2.

package.name: gtk-themes
package.summary: Assorted GTK+ themes
package.description: A collection of assorted GTK+ themes from gtk.themes.org

package.name: gtkhtml
package.summary: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library.
package.description: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library. GtkHTML is not designed to be the ultimate HTML browser/editor: instead, it is designed to be easily embedded into applications that require lightweight HTML functionality. GtkHTML was originally based on KDE's KHTMLW widget, but is now developed independently of it. The most important difference between KHTMLW and GtkHTML, besides being GTK-based, is that GtkHTML is also an editor. Thanks to the Bonobo editor component that comes with the library, it's extremely simple to add HTML editing to an existing application.

package.name: gtop
package.summary: Graphical TOP variant
package.description: The graphical version of top provides an easy interface to process control on a GNU/Linux system.

package.name: helix-sweetpill
package.summary: Sweetpill Sawfish themes from Ximian
package.description: This package contains the Sweetpill set of themes from Ximian, designed by Tuomas Kuosmanen.

package.name: imlib
package.summary: An image loading and rendering library for X11R6
package.description:
Imlib is a display depth-independent image loading and rendering library. Imlib is designed to simplify and speed up the process of loading images and obtaining X Window System drawables. Imlib provides many simple manipulation routines which can be used for common operations.
Install imlib if you need an image loading and rendering library for X11R6. You may also want to install the imlib-cfgeditor package, which will help you configure Imlib.

package.name: imlib-cfgeditor
package.summary: A configuration editor for the Imlib library.
package.description:
The imlib-cfgeditor package contains the imlib_config program, which you can use to configure the Imlib image loading and rendering library. imlib_config can be used to control how Imlib uses color and handles gamma corrections, etc.
If you're installing the imlib package, you should also install imlib_cfgeditor.

package.name: libGConf1
package.summary: GConf is a configuration database system.
package.description: GConf is a configuration database for the GNOME project.

package.name: libGConf1-devel
package.summary: Development libraries and headers for GConf
package.description: GConf is a configuration database for the GNOME project. This package contains the header files and libraries needed to develop applications using GConf

package.name: libao2
package.summary: A Cross-platform Audio Library
package.description: Libao is a cross-platform audio library that allows programs to output audio using a simple API on a wide variety of platforms. It currently supports: * Null output * WAV files * OSS (Open Sound System) * ESD (ESounD or Enlighten Sound Daemon) * ALSA (Advanced Linux Sound Architecture) * Solaris (untested) * IRIX (untested)

package.name: libao2-devel
package.summary: A Cross-platform Audio Library - development files
package.description: Libao is a cross-platform audio library that allows programs to output audio using a simple API on a wide variety of platforms. It currently supports: * Null output * WAV files * OSS (Open Sound System) * ESD (ESounD or Enlighten Sound Daemon) * ALSA (Advanced Linux Sound Architecture) * Solaris (untested) * IRIX (untested)

package.name: libaudiofile0
package.summary: Main library for audiofile
package.description: This package contains the library needed to run programs dynamically linked with audiofile.

package.name: libaudiofile0-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for audiofile application development
package.description: Libraries, include files and other resources you can use to develop audiofile applications.

package.name: libbonobo-conf0
package.summary: bonobo-conf library
package.description: Bonobo-conf is for configuring things through bonobo. This package allows you to use applications that use the bonobo-conf library.

package.name: libbonobo-conf0-devel
package.summary: bonobo-conf library
package.description: Bonobo-conf is for configuring things through bonobo. This package allows you to build applications that use the bonobo-conf library.

package.name: libbonobo2
package.summary: Libraries for Bonobo
package.description: Bonobo is a library that provides the necessary framework for GNOME applications to deal with compound documents, i.e. those with a spreadsheet and graphic embedded in a word-processing document. This package provides libraries to use Bonobo.

package.name: libbonobo2-devel
package.summary: Libraries and header files for the Bonobo component system
package.description: This package provides the necessary development libraries and include files to allow you to develop programs using the Bonobo component system.

package.name: libeel0
package.summary: Eazel Extensions shared Libraries
package.description: Eazel Extensions shared libraries

package.name: libeel0-devel
package.summary: Eazel Extensions Library
package.description: This contains headers and libraries for developing with eel.

package.name: libefs1
package.summary: Embedded File Syste library
package.description: This is a first approach to implement a file-system-inside-a-file. The library is called libefs (EFS = Embedded File System). This package is part of Bonobo.

package.name: libefs1-devel
package.summary: Embedded File System library
package.description: This is a first approach to implement a file-system-inside-a-file. The library is called libefs (EFS = Embedded File System).

package.name: libesound0
package.summary: Libraries for EsounD.
package.description: These are the libraries for EsounD.

package.name: libesound0-devel
package.summary: Libraries and headers for EsounDapplication development
package.description: Libraries, include files and other resources you can use to develop EsounD applications.

package.name: libgal13
package.summary: The GNOME Application Library
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: libgal14
package.summary: The GNOME Application Library
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: libgal14-devel
package.summary: Development files for the GNOME Applications library
package.description: Development files for the GNOME Applications library

package.name: libgal18
package.summary: The GNOME Application Library
package.description: A collection of GNOME widgets and utility functions.

package.name: libgal18-devel
package.summary: Development files for the GNOME Applications library
package.description: Development files for the GNOME Applications library

package.name: libghttp1
package.summary: Gnome HTTP client library
package.description: This library is used by Gnome clients to do HTTP.

package.name: libghttp1-devel
package.summary: Development files for GNOME http library
package.description: This packages provides the include files and static library for the Gnome HTTP functions.

package.name: libgimp1.2_1
package.summary: GIMP libraries
package.description: Libraries used to communicate between The GIMP and other programs which may function as "GIMP plugins".

package.name: libgimp1.2_1-devel
package.summary: GIMP plugin and extension development kit
package.description: Static libraries and header files for writing GIMP plugins and extensions.

package.name: libglade-gnome0
package.summary: GNOME part of the libglade
package.description: This is the gnome part of libglade. The library allows you to load user interfaces in your program, which are stored externally. This allows alteration of the interface without recompilation of the program.

package.name: libglade0
package.summary: The libglade library for loading user interfaces
package.description: Library to load GNOME user interface files at runtime This library allows programs to load externally-stored user interfaces (.glade files) into your program at runtime. External storage of the interface permits alteration of the interface without recompiling. You can change the interface by editing the .glade files or by using GLADE.

package.name: libglade0-devel
package.summary: The files needed for libglade application development.
package.description: The libglade-devel package contains the libraries, include files, etc., that you can use to develop libglade applications.

package.name: libglib1.2
package.summary: A library of handy utility functions
package.description: This library is a collection of handy utility functions. It is designed to solve some portability problems and provide other useful functionality which most programs require. GLib is used by GDK, GTK+ and many applications. You should install the glib package because many of your applications will depend on this library.

package.name: libglib1.2-devel
package.summary: Development files for the GIMP Toolkit (Gtk)
package.description: This package contains the header files and static libraries for the GIMP Toolkit Install this package if you wish to develop your own X programs using the GTK+ widget toolkit, or wish to develop plug-ins for The GIMP.

package.name: libgnet0
package.summary: Networking library
package.description: Gnet is a simple networking library. It is written in C, object-oriented, and built upon glib. It is intended to be small, fast, easy-to-use, and easy to port. The interface is similar to the interface for Java's network library.

package.name: libgnome-vfs0
package.summary: GNOME virtual file-system libraries
package.description: The GNOME Virtual File System provides an abstraction to common file system operations like reading, writing and copying files, listing directories and so on. This package contains librairies used by gnome-vfs

package.name: libgnome-vfs0-devel
package.summary: GNOME virtual file system library.
package.description: This contains headers and libraries for developing with gnome-vfs.

package.description: C++ Lanugage bindings for the GNOME Libraries.

package.name: libgtk+1.2
package.summary: The GIMP Toolkit set of widgets for X
package.description: The GIMP Toolkit is a freely available set of widgets for X. It includes almost every kind of button, slider, and check-box any program is likely to require. Gtk has appeared in such projects as The GNU Image Manipulation Program (The GIMP), GNOME, a GNU desktop set of utilities for X, and gzilla, a GNU web-browser.

package.name: libgtk+1.2-devel
package.summary: Development files for the GIMP Toolkit (Gtk)
package.description: This package contains the header files and static libraries for the GIMP Toolkit Install this package if you wish to develop your own X programs using the GTK+ widget toolkit, or wish to develop plug-ins for The GIMP.

package.name: libgtkhtml17
package.summary: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library.
package.description: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library. GtkHTML is not designed to be the ultimate HTML browser/editor: instead, it is designed to be easily embedded into applications that require lightweight HTML functionality. GtkHTML was originally based on KDE's KHTMLW widget, but is now developed independently of it. The most important difference between KHTMLW and GtkHTML, besides being GTK-based, is that GtkHTML is also an editor. Thanks to the Bonobo editor component that comes with the library, it's extremely simple to add HTML editing to an existing application.

package.name: libgtkhtml18
package.summary: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library.
package.description: GtkHTML is a HTML rendering/editing library. GtkHTML is not designed to be the ultimate HTML browser/editor: instead, it is designed to be easily embedded into applications that require lightweight HTML functionality. GtkHTML was originally based on KDE's KHTMLW widget, but is now developed independently of it. The most important difference between KHTMLW and GtkHTML, besides being GTK-based, is that GtkHTML is also an editor. Thanks to the Bonobo editor component that comes with the library, it's extremely simple to add HTML editing to an existing application.

This package contains the files necessary to develop applications with GtkHTML.

package.name: libgtop1
package.summary: Libraries for gtop system monitoring library (part of Gnome)
package.description: A library and daemon that fetch information about the running system such as CPU and memory useage, active processes and more. On Linux systems, this information is taken directly from the /proc filesystem while on other systems a server is used to read that information from places like /dev/kmem and others. Libgtop and gtop are part of GNOME, the complete desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: libgtop1-devel
package.summary: Development Libraries for gtop system monitoring library (part of Gnome)
package.description: Install this package if you wish to develop applications that access information on system statistics such as CPU and memory usage. Libgtop and gtop are part of GNOME, the complete desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: libguppi15
package.summary: Libraries for Guppi
package.description: This package provides libraries to use Guppi.

package.name: libguppi15-devel
package.summary: Libraries for the Guppi plotting tool
package.description: Set of libraries that allow you to access the Guppi plotting API. Install this package if you wish to add plotting capabilities to GNOME plications through Guppi.

package.name: libimlib1
package.summary: Main library for imlib
package.description: This package contains the library needed to run programs dynamically linked with imlib.

package.name: libimlib1-devel
package.summary: Development tools for Imlib applications.
package.description:
The header files, static libraries and documentation needed for developing Imlib applications. Imlib is an image loading and rendering library for X11R6.
Install the imlib-devel package if you want to develop Imlib applications. You'll also need to install the imlib and imlib_cfgeditor packages.

package.name: liboaf0
package.summary: GNOME Object Activation Framework (for GNOME components)
package.description: OAF (Object Activation Framework) provides the activation mechanism for GNOME components. It is a replacement for GOAD in the GNOME 2 platform.

package.name: liboaf0-devel
package.summary: Development libraries and headers for OAF.
package.description: OAF (Object Activation Framework) provides the avtivation mechanism for GNOME components. It is a replacement for GOAD in the GNOME 2 platform. This package contains the header files and libraries needed to develop applications using OAF.

package.name: libogg0
package.summary: Ogg Bitstream Library
package.description: Libogg is a library for manipulating ogg bitstreams. It handles both making ogg bitstreams and getting packets from ogg bitstreams.

package.name: libogg0-devel
package.summary: Ogg Bitstream Library Development
package.description: The libogg-devel package contains the header files and documentation needed to develop applications with libogg.

package.name: libole20
package.summary: The GNOME Unicode library.
package.description: libole2 is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: libole20-devel
package.summary: The GNOME Unicode library - development files.
package.description: libole2 is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: libpanelmm0
package.summary: C++ bindings for the GNOME Panel
package.description: C++ Lanugage bindings for the GNOME Panel libraries.

package.name: libpanelmm0-devel
package.summary: C++ bindings for the GNOME Panel
package.description: C++ Lanugage bindings for the GNOME Panel Libraries.

package.name: libpilot-link4
package.summary: Libraries needed to use pilot-link
package.description: Libraries needed to use pilot-link

package.name: librep
package.summary: An embeddable Emacs-Lisp-like runtime library
package.description: This is a lightweight LISP environment for UNIX. It contains a LISP interpreter, byte-code compiler and virtual machine. Applications may use the LISP interpreter as an extension language, or it may be used for standalone scripts. Originally inspired by Emacs Lisp, the language dialect combines many of the elisp features while trying to remove some of the main deficiencies, with features from Common Lisp.

package.name: librep-devel
package.summary: development libraries and headers for librep
package.description: This contains the required files to develop software using the librep lisp environment.

package.name: librsvg1
package.summary: SVG rendering library
package.description: The librsvg library is a lightweight library for parsing and rendering vector-graphic files in SVG format (like the ones made by sodipodi). It also includes functions that render anti-aliased fonts using freetype, including caching of glyphs.

package.name: librsvg1-devel
package.summary: SVG rendering library
package.description: This contains headers and libraries for developing with librsvg.

package.name: libscrollkeeper0
package.summary: Libraries for scrollkeeper.
package.description: These are the libraries for Scrollkeeper.

package.name: libscrollkeeper0-devel
package.summary: Includes and more to develop scrollkeeper applications
package.description: Libraries, include files and other resources you can use to develop Scrollkeeper applications.

package.name: libsigc++1.0
package.summary: Typesafe Signal Framework - runtime
package.description: This library implements a full callback system for use in widget libraries, abstract interfaces, and general programming. Originally part of the Gtk-- widget set, libsigc++ is now a separate library to provide for more general use. It is the most complete library of its kind with the ablity to connect an abstract callback to a class method, function, or function object. It contains adaptor classes for connection of dissimilar callbacks and has an ease of use unmatched by other C++ callback libraries. Libsigc++ is licensed under the GNU LGPL.

package.name: libsigc++1.0-devel
package.summary: Typesafe Signal Framework - development files
package.description: This library implements a full callback system for use in widget libraries, abstract interfaces, and general programming. Originally part of the Gtk-- widget set, libsigc++ is now a separate library to provide for more general use. It is the most complete library of its kind with the ablity to connect an abstract callback to a class method, function, or function object. It contains adaptor classes for connection of dissimilar callbacks and has an ease of use unmatched by other C++ callback libraries. Libsigc++ is licensed under the GNU LGPL.

package.name: libunicode0
package.summary: The GNOME Unicode library.
package.description: libunicode is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: libunicode0-devel
package.summary: The GNOME Unicode library - development files.
package.description: libunicode is a library for manipulating Unicode characters and strings. It understands both the UTF-8 and UCS-2 encodings, and has a framework for adding support for new encodings.

package.name: libvorbis0
package.summary: The Vorbis General Audio Compression Codec
package.description: Ogg Vorbis is a fully open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free, general-purpose compressed audio format for audio and music at fixed and variable bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel.

package.name: libvorbis0-devel
package.summary: Development library for OGG Vorbis
package.description: Ogg Vorbis is a fully Open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free, general-purpose compressed audio format for high quality (44.1-48.0kHz, 16+ bit, polyphonic) audio and music at fixed and variable bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel. This places Vorbis in the same class as audio representations including MPEG-1 audio layer 3, MPEG-4 audio (AAC and TwinVQ), and PAC.

package.name: libxml
package.summary: Library to let GNOME applications use XML
package.description: This library lets GNOME applications use XML, a metalanguage to let you design your own markup language. A regular markup language defines a way to describe information in a certain class of documents (eg HTML). XML lets you define your own customized markup languages for many classes of document. It can do this because it's written in SGML, the international standard metalanguage for markup languages.

package.name: libxml-devel
package.summary: Libraries, includes and other files to develop libxml applications.
package.description: The libxml-devel package contains the libraries, includes and other files you can use to develop libxml applications.

package.name: libxmms1
package.summary: Library associated with xmms, needed for xmms and its plugins.
package.description: This library is mandatory for xmms and for all its plugins to run.

package.name: libxmms1-devel
package.summary: XMMS - Static libraries and header files.
package.description: Static libraries and header files required for compiling xmms plugins.

package.name: mc
package.summary: A user-friendly file manager and visual shell
package.description: Midnight Commander is text-based (but feature-rich!) file manager reminiscent of the Norton Commander on steroids. Capabilites include mouse support (for both xterm and console), undelete (ext2 filesystems only), FTP, and binary and text editing. MC is also capable of most system administration tasks, including the browsing, unpacking, and installation of deb, rpm, zip, zoo, and tar.gz files.

package.name: memprof
package.summary: Memory profiler and leak detector
package.description: Memprof is a tool for profiling memory usage and detecting memory leaks. It can be used with existing binaries without need for recompilation.

package.name: monkeytalk
package.summary: Ximian's online support chat client
package.description: Ximian Monkeytalk allows users to ask questions of Ximian Support staff and eathother, for free and in real-time.

package.name: mozilla
package.summary: Mozilla Web Browser - core and browser
package.description: Mozilla is a sophisticated graphical World-Wide-Web browser, with a large number of various browser features like support for HTML 4.0, CSS 2, JavaScript and Java. Of course, besides the network option, it can also be used as a standalone HTML viewer. Mozilla is based on part of the codebase of the well known "Netscape" ("Communicator" or "Navigator") browser. It was opened up to the free software community by Netscape Communications under a new NPL licence. See the website http://www.mozilla.org/ for more information on the development of Mozilla.

update.description: Bug Fixes, Dependency Fixes, New Upstream Version

package.description: Mail/news client based on the Mozilla web browser. The mail/news client supports IMAP, POP, and NNTP and has an easy to use interface.

package.name: nautilus
package.summary: file manager and graphical shell being
package.description: Nautilus is an open-source file manager and graphical shell being developed by Eazel, Inc. and others. It is part of the GNOME project, and its source code can be found in the GNOME CVS repository. Nautilus is still in the early stages of development. It will become an integral part of the GNOME desktop environment when it is finished.

package.name: nautilus-devel
package.summary: Libraries and include files for developing Nautilus components
package.description: This package provides the necessary development libraries and include files to allow you to develop Nautilus components.

package.name: nautilus-mozilla
package.summary: Nautilus component for use with Mozilla
package.description: This enables the use of embedded Mozilla as a Nautilus component.

package.name: pan
package.summary: Pan Newsreader
package.description: Pan is a newsreader. It is GTK based, supports multiple servers, threading, and multi-part binaries. Fairly lightwieght and fast. If you like Forte's Agent for Windows, you might like this Newsreader.

package.name: perl-GTK
package.summary: Perl module for the gtk+ library
package.description: This module lets you use the gtk+ graphic library from perl. It is very object-oriented and easy to use.

package.name: perl-GTK-GdkImlib
package.summary: Perl module for the gdk-imlib libraries
package.description: see perl-GTK

package.name: perl-GTK-GdkPixbuf
package.summary: Perl module for the gdk-pixbuf libraries
package.description: see perl-GTK

package.name: perl-GTK-Glade
package.summary: Perl module for the Glade libraries
package.description: see perl-GTK

package.name: perl-GTK-Gnome
package.summary: Perl module for the GNOME library
package.description: see perl-GTK

package.name: perl-GTK-GnomePrint
package.summary: Perl module for the gdk-imlib libraries
package.description: see perl-GTK

package.name: perl-TimeDate
package.summary: TimeDate extension for Perl5
package.description: This package provides functions for handling times and dates in various fotats.

package.name: pilot-link
package.summary: PalmOS link utilities
package.description: This suite of tools allows you to upload and download programs and data files between a *nix machine and Palm OS-based devices. It has a few extra utils that will allow for things like syncing the Pilot's calendar app with ical. Note that you might still need to consult the sources for pilot-link if you would like the Python, Tcl, or Perl bindings.

package.name: pilot-link-devel
package.summary: Pilot development header files.
package.description: This package contains the development headers that are used to build the pilot-link package. It also includes the static libraries necessary to build static pilot apps.

package.name: pygnome
package.summary: Python bindings for the GNOME libraries.
package.description: This is a set of bindings for the GNOME libraries for use with Python.

package.name: pygnome-applet
package.summary: Python bindings for GNOME Panel applets.
package.description: This module contains a wrapper that allows GNOME Panel applets to be written in Python.

package.name: pygnome-capplet
package.summary: Python bindings for GNOME Panel applets.
package.description: This module contains a wrapper that allows GNOME Panel applets to be written in Python.

package.name: pygnome-libglade
package.summary: Put a bit of python code behind interfaces built with GLADE.
package.description: This package allows you to write programs in python that interface with the glade libraries.

package.name: pygtk
package.summary: Python bindings for the GTK+ widget set.
package.description: Install pygtk if you need Python bindings for the GTK+ widget set. PyGTK is an extension module for Python that gives you access to the GTK+ widget set. Just about anything you can write in C with GTK+ you can write in Python with PyGTK (within reason), but with all of Python's benefits. PyGTK provides an object-oriented interface at a slightly higher level than the C interface. The PyGTK interface does all of the type casting and reference counting that you'd have to do yourself using the C API. GNOME is the complete desktop environment based entirely on free software.

package.name: pygtk-libglade
package.summary: A wrapper for the libglade library for use with PyGTK
package.description: This module contains runtime GNOME Gtk+ support to supplement the libglade python wrapper.

package.name: red-carpet
package.summary: Ximian's next-generation software manager and updater
package.description: Ximian Red Carpet is a fully featured software updater and manager.

update.description: Red Carpet Express and dependency fixes
Red Carpet Express and SOCKS proxy fixes
Improvements to the way Red Carpet Express works through firewalls

package.name: rep-gtk
package.summary: GTK binding for librep
package.description: This package provides an interface to the GTK graphical toolkit for the librep lisp interpreter.

package.name: rep-gtk-gnome
package.summary: GNOME binding for librep
package.description: This is a binding of the various GNOME libraries for the librep Lisp interpreter. It includes support for the basic GNOME functions, the GNOME user interface widgets, and the GNOME Canvas architecture.

package.name: rep-gtk-libglade
package.summary: Glade binding for librep
package.description: This is a binding of libglade for the librep Lisp interpreter.

package.name: sawfish
package.summary: A highly configurable and extensible X11 window manager.
package.description: Sawfish is an extensible window manager using an Emacs LISP-like scripting language. All window decorations are configurable, and the Lisp language controls as much user-interface policy as possible. This is not a layer on top of twm, but a wholly new architecture.

update.description: Dependency and bug fixes. Sawfish users should run sawfish-client -f restart in a terminal window after this upgrade.

package.name: sawfish-themer
package.summary: GUI for creating sawfish themes.
package.description: Optional theme builder for sawfish. Allows static window themes to be created/edited in a graphical environment.

update.description: Dependency and bug fixes. Sawfish users should run sawfish-client -f restart in a terminal window after this upgrade.

package.name: sawfish-themes
package.summary: Assorted Sawfish themes
package.description: A collection of assorted Sawfish themes from sawfish.themes.org

package.name: scrollkeeper
package.summary: A free electronic cataloging system for documentation.
package.description: It stores metadata specified by the http://www.ibiblio.org/osrt/omf/ (Open Source Metadata Framework) as well as certain metadata extracted directly from documents (such as the table of contents). It provides various functionality pertaining to this metadata to help browsers, such as sorting the registered documents or searching the metadata for documents which satisfy a set of criteria.

package.name: soup
package.summary: Simple Object Access Protocol implementation
package.description: Soup provides an queued asynchronous callback-based mechanism for sending and servicing SOAP requests, and a WSDL (Web Service Definition Language) to C compiler which generates client stubs and server skeletons for easily calling and implementing SOAP methods.

package.name: soup-devel
package.summary: Simple Object Access Protocol implementation
package.description: Soup provides an queued asynchronous callback-based mechanism for sending and servicing SOAP requests, and a WSDL (Web Service Definition Language) to C compiler which generates client stubs and server skeletons for easily calling and implementing SOAP methods. This package allows you to develop applications that use the Soup library.

package.name: vorbis-tools
package.summary: Ogg Vorbis tools
package.description: This package contains: * ogg123 * oggenc * ogginfo * vcut * vorbiscomment

package.name: xchat
package.summary: A GNOME Internet Relay Chat (IRC) client
package.description: The full GNOME version of an attractive IRC client with full DCC and plugin support, text-color and shading transparency, tabbed channel seperation, and more.

package.name: ximian-doorman
package.summary: A desktop setup tool for first-time users.
package.description: The doorman runs the first time a user logs into Ximian GNOME. It steps the user through setting up his system and modifies his GNOME configuration files accordingly.

package.name: ximian-faq
package.summary: Ximian GNOME Frequently Asked Questions
package.description: Some frequently asked questions about Ximian GNOME, available from the menubar.

package.name: ximian-menus
package.summary: Ximian GNOME's new menu arrangement.
package.description: This package contains a set of menu files which create Ximian GNOME's Programs menu.

package.name: ximian-south
package.summary: Ximian South Nautilus theme
package.description: This package provides the Ximian South theme for Nautilus

update.description: New toolbar, New media icons, New PGP icons

package.name: ximian-utils
package.summary: Ximian Utilities
package.description: This package contains a set of utilities for the Ximian GNOME desktop. This includes an improved file search dialog and a bonobo-based file viewer.

package.name: ximian-wallpapers
package.summary: Pretty backgrounds for your desktop.
package.description: A collection of nice Ximian wallpapers for your Ximian GNOME desktop.

package.name: xmms
package.summary: Audio player for the X Window System
package.description: XMMS (formerly known as X11Amp) is an X/GTK+ based audio player for various audio formats. . It's able to read and play: * Audio MPEG layer 1, 2, and 3 (with mpg123 plug-in), * WAV, RAW, AU (with internal wav plug-in and MikMod plug-in), * MOD, XM, S3M, and other module formats (with MikMod plug-in), * CD Audio (with CDAudio plug-in), with CDDB support, * .cin files, id Software. It has eSound, OSS, and disk writer support for outputting sound. . It looks almost the same as the famous Winamp, and includes those neat features like plug-ins, several of which come bundled, a spectrum analyzer, oscilloscope, WinAmp skins support, and a playlist window.

package.name: xmms-diskwriter
package.summary: DiskWriter output backend
package.description: Output plugin for xmms in order to output *.wav files instead of playing sound on the soundcard.

package.name: xmms-esd
package.summary: XMMS - Output plugin for use with the esound package.
package.description: Output plugin for xmms for use with the esound package

package.name: xmms-gnome
package.summary: XMMS - applet for controlling xmms from the GNOME panel.
package.description: GNOME applet for controlling xmms from the GNOME panel

package.name: xmms-mesa
package.summary: Visualization plugins that use the Mesa library
package.description: 3D Visualization plugins for XMMS that use the Mesa library.

package.name: xmms-mikmod
package.summary: XMMS - Input plugin to play MODs.
package.description: Input plugin form XMMS to play MODs (.MOD,.XM,.S3M, etc)

package.name: xsane
package.summary: An X Window System front-end for the SANE scanner interface.
package.description: XSane is an X based interface for the SANE (Scanner Access Now Easy) library, which provides access to scanners, digital cameras, and other capture devices. XSane is written in GTK+ and provides control for performing the scan and then manipulating the captured image.

package.name: xsane-gimp
package.summary: A GIMP plugin which provides a scanner interface.
package.description: This package is the same as the regular XSane program, but it works as a GIMP plugin. You must have GIMP installed to use this package.

package.name: xscreensaver
package.summary: Automatic screensaver for X
package.description: The purpose of xscreensaver is to display pretty pictures on your screen when it is not in use, in keeping with the philosophy that unattended monitors should always be doing something interesting, just like they do in the movies. The benefit that this program has over the combination of the xlock and xautolock programs is the ease with which new graphics hacks can be installed: you don't need to recompile this program to add a new display mode, you just change some resource settings. Any program which can be invoked in such a way that it draws on the root window of the screen can now be used as a screensaver without modification. The programs that are being run as screensavers don't need to have any special knowledge about what it means to be a screensaver.

update.description: Build with the correct tarball this time, previews work now

package.name: xscreensaver-gl
package.summary: GL(Mesa) screenhacks for xscreensaver
package.description: These are some extra hacks for xscreensaver that use the Mesa OpenGL-compatible library. They are included as an extra package so the base package doesn't require Mesa.

update.description: Build with the correct tarball this time, previews work now

package.name: gnome-pim-conduits
package.summary: Palm synchronization for calendar and address book.
package.description: GNOME is the "GNU Network Object Model Environment" It is a project to build a complete, user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software. This package contains conduits to synchronize your address book and calendar between your GNOME system and your Palm.

package.name: gnome-pim
package.summary: Calendar and address book for GNOME.
package.description: GNOME is the "GNU Network Object Model Environment" It is a project to build a complete, user-friendly desktop based entirely on free software. This package contains a calendar tool with notifications and multiple views, and an address book.

package.name: gnome-spell
package.summary: GNOME spell checking component
package.description: Gnome Spell is GNOME/Bonobo component for spell checking. It contains the GNOME::Spell::Dictionary object, which provides a spell checking dictionary (see Spell.idl for exact API definition). It is based on pspell.

package.name: libguppi16-devel

package.name: pkgconfig
package.summary: pkg-config is a system for managing library compile/link flags.
package.description: pkg-config is a system for managing library compile/link flags that works with automake and autoconf. It replaces the ubiquitous *-config scripts you may have seen with a single tool. There's nothing desktop-specific or desktop-related about pkg-config, despite it being on freedesktop.org.

package.name: gnome-pilot-conduits
package.summary: Extra gnome-pilot conduits
package.description: This is a collection of additional conduits for gnome-pilot, it currently features a MAL conduit for AvantGo syncing

package.name: intltool
package.summary: XML Internationalization Tools
package.description: Tools to help with internationalization of xml files.

package.name: xmms-skins
package.summary: XMMS Skins package from Ximian
package.description: A set of Skins for use with the XMMS media player.

package.name: libsane1-devel
package.summary: The SANE (a universal scanner interface) development toolkit.
package.description: Static libraries and header files for writing Scanner Access Now Easy (SANE) modules. SANE is a universal scanner interface which is included in the sane package.

package.name: libsane1
package.summary: SANE - local and remote scanner access. This package contains the sane library.
package.description: SANE (Scanner Access Now Easy) is a sane and simple interface to both local and networked scanners and other image acquisition devices like digital still and video cameras. SANE currently includes modules for accessing a range of scanners, including models from Agfa SnapScan, Apple, Artec, Canon, CoolScan, Epson, HP, Microtek, Mustek, Nikon, Siemens, Tamarack, UMAX, Connectix, QuickCams and other SANE devices via network. For the latest information on SANE, the SANE standard definition, and mailing list access, see http://www.mostang.com/sane/ This package does not enable network scanning by default; if you wish to enable it, read the saned(1) manpage.

package.name: sane
package.summary: SANE - local and remote scanner access. This package contains command line utilities
package.description: SANE (Scanner Access Now Easy) is a sane and simple interface to both local and networked scanners and other image acquisition devices like digital still and video cameras. SANE currently includes modules for accessing a range of scanners, including models from Agfa SnapScan, Apple, Artec, Canon, CoolScan, Epson, HP, Microtek, Mustek, Nikon, Siemens, Tamarack, UMAX, Connectix, QuickCams and other SANE devices via network. For the latest information on SANE, the SANE standard definition, and mailing list access, see http://www.mostang.com/sane/ This package does not enable network scanning by default; if you wish to enable it, read the saned(1) manpage.

package.name: sane-backends
package.summary: Scanner access software.
package.description: Scanner Access Now Easy (SANE) is a universal scanner interface. The SANE application programming interface (API) provides standardized access to any raster image scanner hardware (flatbed scanner, hand-held scanner, video and still cameras, frame-grabbers, etc.). If they're using SANE, developers can write image-processing applications without having to think about the peculiarities of individual devices. SANE also makes it possible to write a device driver once, which can then be used by any SANE-compliant application. SANE currently includes drivers for some Epson SCSI scanners, HP ScanJet SCSI scanners, Microtek SCSI scanners, Mustek SCSI flatbed scanners, PINT devices, most UMAX SCSI scanners, Connectix QuickCam, and other SANE devices via network. Note that this package does not enable network scanning by default. If you wish to enable network scanning, read the saned(1) manpage. If you'd like to develop SANE modules, you should also install the sane-devel package.

package.name: sane-frontends
package.summary: Scanner graphical front-ends
package.description: This package includes scanner graphical front-end xscanimage, and xcam, for acquiring images continuously from cameras. An alternative to xscanimage called xsane is packaged separately. The scanner front-ends use SANE. SANE stands for "Scanner Access Now Easy" and is an application programming interface (API) that provides standardized access to any raster image scanner hardware (flatbed scanner, hand-held scanner, video- and still-cameras, frame-grabbers, etc.). The SANE standard is free and its discussion and development is open to everybody. The current source code is written for UNIX (including Linux) and is available under the GNU public license (commercial application and backends are welcome, too, however).

package.name: libgnet1-devel
package.summary: Networking library
package.description: Gnet is a simple network library. It is written in C, object-oriented, and built upon glib. This package allows you to develop applications that use the Gnet library.

update.description: Build for new monkeytalk and gnomeicu

package.name: libgnet1
package.summary: Networking library
package.description: Gnet is a simple networking library. It is written in C, object-oriented, and built upon glib. It is intended to be small, fast, easy-to-use, and easy to port. The interface is similar to the interface for Java's network library.

update.description: Build for new monkeytalk and gnomeicu

package.name: mozilla-nspr
package.summary: Netscape Portable Runtime Library
package.description: This library provides platform independent non-GUI operating system facilities including: * threads, * thread synchronisation, * normal file I/O and network I/O, * interval timing and calender time, * basic memory management (malloc and free), * shared library linking. . See http://www.mozilla.org/docs/refList/refNSPR/ for more information.

update.description: Bug Fixes, Dependency Fixes, New Upstream Version

package.name: mozilla-nspr-devel
package.summary: Netscape Portable Runtime library - development files
package.description: NSPR provides platform independence for non-GUI operating system facilities including: * threads, * thread synchronisation, * normal file I/O and network I/O, * interval timing and calender time, * basic memory management (malloc and free), * shared library linking. . See http://www.mozilla.org/docs/refList/refNSPR/ for more information. . You need this package to get includes and static libraries for building programs linked to NSPR.

update.description: Bug Fixes, Dependency Fixes, New Upstream Version
